learning_outcomes.description: Identify molecular targets that may be useful in studying disease processes
Demonstrate a clear understanding of the properties an imaging probe should possess to enable in vivo imaging of the molecular target of interest

Synthesise your knowledge to provide the rationale for determining whether a drug is suitable for development into an imaging probe and the isotopes and radiolabelling methodologies associated with that process

assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Quiz, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This quiz is worth 15 marks. Several questions will be randomly selected from a larger pool of questions.

Please allow an uninterrupted 30 minutes to take the quiz.

When the time runs out the quiz will automatically be saved and submitted as is. The quiz will be available for 1 week only, during Week 7. It will be visible from Monday 9am and close on Thursday at 2pm (Brisbane time).
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to write responses (less than 3 pages total) to a series of questions listed on Ultra and submit via TurnItIn.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit through TurnItIn on Ultra. Students are permitted to submit a draft.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam will be an in-person, paper-based exam. Students enrolled externally, please refer to the course profile for External students for in-person examination arrangements.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date: Throughout the semester, Discussion Board locked 1 week after each Module.
assessments.task_description:
There are several online Questions, Discussions and Tutorials posted on the Discussion Board on Ultra. For each in which you submit a response by the due date, you will receive marks, to a maximum of 10 in total.


It is expected for students to participate in >80% of discussion boards and grades will be awarded as a percentage relative to the level of participation below this. Refer to Ultra for further details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
